ptyx module documentation¶

class ptyx.LatexGenerator¶

Convert text containing ptyx tags to plain LaTeX.

parse(text)¶

Convert text containing ptyx tags to plain LaTeX.

Parameters:text (str) – a pTyX file content, to be converted to plain LaTeX.
parse_node(node)¶

Parse a node in a pTyX syntax tree.

Return True if block content was recursively parsed, and False else.

In particular, when parsing an IF block, True will be returned if and only if the block condition was satisfied.

write(text, parse=False)¶

Append a piece of LaTeX text to context[‘LATEX’].

Parameters:
  • text (string) – a block of text, which may contain pTyX code.
  • parse (bool) – indicate text have to be parsed.

Note

Param parse defaults to False, since in most cases text is already parsed at this state. As an exception, when called from inside a #PYTHON [...] #END code block, write() may be applied to unparsed text.

class ptyx.CustomOutput(logfile_name='')¶
class ptyx.SpecialDict¶
class ptyx.Node(name)¶

A node.

name is the tag name, or the argument number.

arg(i)¶

Return argument number i content.

class ptyx.SyntaxTreeGenerator¶
parse(text)¶

Parse pTyX code and generate a syntax tree.

Parameters:text (string) – some pTyX code.

Note

To access generated syntax tree, use .syntax_tree attribute.
